skill.name: command-optimization
skill.description: CLI command development specialist. Use when creating commands, designing argument parsing, automating tasks, or implementing CLI best practices. Specializes in command design patterns and user experience.
skill.summary: CLI command development specialist. Use when creating commands, designing argument parsing, automati...
skill.author: Joseph OBrien

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and guidance for CLI command design. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access. All content is instructional with no security concerns.

content.value_statement: Creating effective command-line interfaces requires understanding design patterns, argument parsing, and user experience principles. This skill provides expert guidance for building intuitive, well-documented CLI tools that follow established conventions.
actual_capabilities: Design clear, action-oriented CLI command structures
Create intuitive argument and option parsing patterns
Implement robust error handling and validation
Apply user experience best practices for CLI tools
Document commands with helpful output and examples
limitations: Does not execute shell commands or modify files
Does not access system environment or configuration
Does not integrate with specific CLI frameworks or libraries
Provides guidance only, no automated command generation

use_cases.title: Standardize CLI Commands
use_cases.description: Create consistent command patterns across your project for better developer experience and maintainability.

use_cases.title: Automate Task Scripts
use_cases.description: Design command-line tools that automate repetitive deployment and maintenance tasks efficiently.

use_cases.title: Build CLI Utilities
use_cases.description: Develop well-structured CLI utilities with proper argument handling and error feedback.

prompt_templates.title: Create New Command
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a command to generate [component-type] with [options]

prompt_templates.title: Improve Existing Command
prompt_templates.prompt: Improve the user experience of this command: [paste command code]

prompt_templates.title: Design Argument Structure
prompt_templates.prompt: Design an argument parsing structure for a [command-type] command that accepts [input-types]

prompt_templates.title: Add Error Handling
prompt_templates.prompt: Add robust error handling and validation to this CLI command: [paste command code]

output_examples.input: Create a command to generate React components
output: Examples included with clear usage patterns

best_practices: Use clear, action-oriented command names (generate, create, build)
Validate inputs early with specific, actionable error messages
Support --dry-run for preview and --verbose for detailed output
anti_patterns: Using vague command names that lack clear purpose
Failing to validate file existence and permissions before operations
Providing generic error messages without context or suggested fixes

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code for all command design and optimization tasks.

faq.question: Does this skill execute shell commands?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides guidance and templates only. It does not run or modify any system commands.

faq.question: Can it generate complete CLI tools?
faq.answer: It provides designs and patterns for commands. You implement the actual code in your project.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill is prompt-only and does not access files, networks, or system resources.

faq.question: What command naming conventions does it recommend?
faq.answer: Action-oriented names like generate:component, analyze:dependencies, and db:migrate with consistent verb:noun structure.

faq.question: How does this compare to framework-specific CLI tools?
faq.answer: This skill teaches general CLI principles. Use framework-specific tools for actual code generation within those frameworks.
